amendment.description: Amendment prohibits the use of funds for entering into contracts with offerors who have been convicted of embezzlement, theft, forgery, bribery, falsification or destruction of records, making false statements, tax evasion, violating Federal criminal tax laws, receiving stolen property and other specified violations.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 14 printed in the Congressional Record to prohibit the use of funds to be used to enter into a contract with any offeror or any of it principals if the offeror certifies, as required by Federal Acquisition Regulation.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A049) Agreed to by voice vote.
